<title level="1" right="Focus 2" pfs="Standard">
[Soothing Mist](/Spells.aspx?ID=1869)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Ranger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=682" />
<trait label="Vitality" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=509" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 383 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing living creature or 1 undead creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You call forth a magical mist that envelops a creature. The mist restores 2d8 Hit Points to a target living creature and ends one source of [persistent acid, bleed, fire, poison, or void damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) affecting it. If the creature is taking persistent damage from multiple sources, you select which one is removed. Against an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) target, you deal 2d8 vitality damage ([basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save); if it fails the save, it also takes 2 persistent vitality damage.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The amount of healing (or damage to an undead target) increases by 1d8, and the persistent vitality damage to an undead creature increases by 1.
name: Soothing Mist
